meanings.definition: The opening words of a text, especially when used as a title.
meanings.sent1: The incipits of the book set the tone for the story.
meanings.sent2: She always pays attention to the incipits of novels to get a sense of what to expect.
meanings.sent3: The incipits of the recipe book made her laugh as they were written in rhyme.
meanings.sent4: His incipits were like a key that unlocked the mysteries hidden within the text.
meanings.sent5: The incipits were like a welcoming handshake, inviting readers into the world of the story.

meanings.definition: The beginning or introductory part of a piece of music or literature.
meanings.sent1: The incipits of the song immediately caught the audience's attention.
meanings.sent2: In literature, the incipits often set the stage for the rest of the work.
meanings.sent3: The incipits of the play were so dramatic that they made everyone gasp.
meanings.sent4: Her incipits were like a beacon, guiding listeners through the emotional journey of the music.
meanings.sent5: The incipits were like a spark that ignited the imagination of the readers.
